title.value: A Minimax Approach Against Multi-Armed Adversarial Attacks Detection
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the top of the research paper and appropriately summarizes the primary subject of the research.
title.quote: "A Minimax Approach Against Multi-Armed Adversarial Attacks Detection"

extractions.description: The paper presents a minimax approach to detect adversarial attacks that use multiple strategies and loss functions simultaneously. It proposes an aggregation framework that combines multiple pre-trained detectors into a more robust system against such multi-armed attacks.

type.justification: The study involves empirical evaluations and comparisons of the proposed method with existing state-of-the-art methods on datasets like CIFAR10 and SVHN. It tests and validates the effectiveness of the method through extensive experimentation.
type.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

name.justification: The paper focuses on evaluating the proposed adversarial detection method on image datasets like CIFAR10 and SVHN, which are commonly used in the domain of computer vision.
name.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is to develop and evaluate a method for detecting adversarial attacks on machine learning models.
name.quote: "This method can aggregate pre-trained detectors without the need for additional training."

name.justification: The empirical evaluations are performed using ResNet-18 as the target classifier on which adversarial attacks are simulated.
name.quote: "We run our experiments on CIFAR10 [49] and SVHN [50] image datasets. For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 models that has been trained for 100 epochs, using SGD optimizer with a learning rate equal to 0.1, weight decay equal to 10−5, and momentum equal to 0.9."

is_contributed.justification: ResNet-18 was not contributed by this paper; it is used as a pre-trained model for evaluations.
is_contributed.quote: "For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 models that has been trained for 100 epochs, using SGD optimizer with a learning rate equal to 0.1, weight decay equal to 10−5, and momentum equal to 0.9."

is_executed.justification: The model is executed in the scope of the paper to evaluate the detection method.
is_executed.quote: "We run our experiments on CIFAR10 [49] and SVHN [50] image datasets. For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 models that has been trained for 100 epochs, using SGD optimizer with a learning rate equal to 0.1, weight decay equal to 10−5, and momentum equal to 0.9."

is_compared.justification: Numerical comparisons are made to evaluate the proposed method's performance against adversarial attacks.
is_compared.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: ResNet-18 is a well-known model architecture introduced in the referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: "For both, the pre-trained target classifier is a ResNet-18 models that has been trained for 100 epochs, using SGD optimizer with a learning rate equal to 0.1, weight decay equal to 10−5, and momentum equal to 0.9."

name.justification: CIFAR10 is one of the primary datasets used for evaluating the proposed adversarial detection method.
name.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning Multiple Layers of Features from Tiny Images
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper introduces the CIFAR10 dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

name.justification: SVHN is another dataset used to evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed adversarial detection method.
name.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."

referenced_paper_title.value: Reading Digits in Natural Images with Unsupervised Feature Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The SVHN dataset was introduced in the referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: "Through extensive evaluation on popular datasets (e.g., CIFAR10 and SVHN), we show that our aggregation consistently outperforms individual state-of-the-art detectors against multi-armed adversarial attacks."
